title: Ticket #3221: negotiator ASSERTs
description:
the negotiator will ASSERT if it finds a duplicate ad keyed on (Name,StartdIpAddr).

however, since 7.5.0 ads now contain MyAddress instead of StartdIpAddr, and the collector keys ads using (Name,MyAddress).

so, in 7.5.0 and beyond, it's possible for the collector to give a list of ads to the negotiator that from the collector's perspective are unique, but from the negotiator's perspective contain duplicate keys, and it asserts.

i propose two changes:

1) the negotiator should use the same key as the collector

2) if the negotiator sees a duplicate key, discard that ad instead of ASSERTing.
remarks:
2012-Sep-06 17:13:31 by danb:
What about using the same function the collector does: makeStartdAdHashKey?

2012-Sep-06 17:26:16 by zmiller:
yes, makeStartdAdHashKey is what i used in the proposed patch to solve item 1. so i think we agree there. i'm going to commit this to V7_8-branch so i appreciate the extra scrutiny.

2012-Sep-07 10:03:09 by danb:
Code review: looks good to me!
2012-Sep-19 16:15:53 by zmiller:
Bulk change of target version from v070804 to v070805 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2012-Sep-26 12:00:00 by jfrey:
Instructions for working around the bug in 7.8.4: NegotiatorAssertWorkaround
